private_information: I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I prefer compact travel and can accept short walks or brief transit
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friends met and ensure meeting Ronald for at least 105 minutes when feasible

private_information: I will be at Russian Hill from 15:15 to 21:30
I can meet for long blocks but prefer continuous meetings when possible
ronald.goal: Be available for meetings at Russian Hill within the specified window and allow a meeting of at least 105 minutes

orchestrator.goal: Integrate proposed schedules and availabilities and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that encodes travel, time windows, meeting durations, and an objective to maximize meetings while satisfying the Ronald constraint

public_information: Travel times in minutes: Chinatown to Russian Hill 7, Russian Hill to Chinatown 9
Ronald will be at Russian Hill from 15:15 to 21:30
Minimum required meeting duration with Ronald is 105 minutes

propose_schedules.system_prompt: You are the traveler planning a day of meetings. Using public information and your private preferences, produce several candidate schedules. Each candidate schedule should be a sequence of visits specifying friend name, location, proposed start time and duration. Respect travel times and the start time. Do not produce PDDL here. Provide alternative schedules that explore different trade offs between meeting many friends and long meetings.
propose_schedules.prompt: Your name is traveler. Propose multiple alternative schedules that list ordered visits with location, start time, and duration. Consider travel times between locations, arrival at Chinatown at 09:00, and the goal to meet as many friends as possible while meeting Ronald for at least 105 minutes when possible.

provide_availability.system_prompt: You are Ronald and will declare your precise availability windows and any preferences for meeting durations or constraints. Provide availability as explicit time windows and any restrictions. Do not produce PDDL.
provide_availability.prompt: Your name is ronald. Provide the exact availability interval(s) at Russian Hill and any preferences about continuous meeting length. The orchestrator will use this information to build the scheduling problem.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at translating scheduling and temporal constraints into PDDL formatted for the FastDownward planner. Receive candidate schedules and availability windows from agents, reconcile them with travel times and the start time, and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes locations, travel actions with durations, meeting actions with duration constraints and time windows, and an optimization objective to maximize the number of meetings while ensuring Ronald is met for at least 105 minutes. Keep actions for different agents distinct. Output the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward, including any required temporal or metric constructs.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public environment information, travel times, the traveler's candidate schedules, and Ronald's availability to produce a unified PDDL domain and PDDL problem solvable by FastDownward. Encode time discretely in minutes or a suitable discretization, include travel and meet actions, enforce Ronald's minimum meeting duration of 105 minutes, and include a metric to maximize number of distinct friends met. If candidate schedules conflict or lack detail, reconcile them conservatively and document assumptions. Provide the final PDDL domain and problem.
